title: Ad Tailoring and Polarization
affiliations: University of Wisconsin-Madison

detail.title: Ad Tailoring and Polarization
detail.abstract: Congressional candidates simultaneously seek votes from local residents and money from partisan potential donors who live across the United States. Ad targeting allows political candidates an inexpensive way not only to reach this dispersed partisan audience but also to deliver messages tailored to donors, whose preferences are more extreme than voters'. Using data on geographically-targeted Facebook ads, I find that the national ads of Democratic and Republican candidates have less issue overlap-and are more polarized-than their local, voter-targeted ads. Candidates' ability to direct tailored, extreme communication to receptive audiences via targeted ads facilitates polarized political speech.

AI.tldr: 国会候选人通过Facebook地理定向广告向全国范围内的党派捐赠者发送比本地选民更极端的极化信息，导致政治言论更加极化

AI.method: 使用Facebook地理定向广告数据，比较民主党与共和党候选人全国广告和本地广告的议题重叠度和极化程度

title: Deep Learning-Based Anomaly Detection for Cyber Threats in Critical Infrastructure Systems
affiliations: Ladoke Akintola University of Technology (LAUTECH)

detail.title: Deep Learning-Based Anomaly Detection for Cyber Threats in Critical Infrastructure Systems
detail.abstract: The increasing frequency and sophistication of cyber threats pose significant risks to critical infrastructure systems, including power grids, water treatment facilities, and transportation networks. This study investigates the application of deep learning techniques for anomaly detection as a proactive defense mechanism against cyber intrusions in such vital systems. The primary objective is to enhance the timely and accurate identification of malicious activities by leveraging the pattern recognition capabilities of deep neural networks. A hybrid research methodology was adopted, combining real-world industrial control system (ICS) datasets with simulated attack scenarios to evaluate model performance. Various deep learning architectures, including Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs), and Autoencoders, were implemented and compared based on detection accuracy, false positive rate, and computational efficiency. The findings reveal that Autoencoder-based models exhibited superior performance in detecting subtle anomalies with minimal false positives, while RNNs demonstrated robustness in capturing temporal dependencies within network traffic. The study underscores the potential of deep learning in bolstering cybersecurity resilience in critical infrastructure and offers insights into selecting appropriate model architectures for real-time threat detection.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨深度学习技术在关键基础设施网络入侵检测中的应用，通过对比CNN、RNN和自编码器等模型，发现自编码器在检测细微异常方面表现最佳，RNN在捕获时间依赖性方面具有优势。
AI.research_question: 深度学习技术如何有效应用于关键基础设施系统的网络入侵异常检测？
AI.motivation: 网络威胁频率和复杂性的增加对关键基础设施系统构成重大风险，需要开发主动防御机制来及时准确识别恶意活动。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于深度学习的模式识别理论，包括卷积神经网络、循环神经网络和自编码器等深度学习架构的理论基础。
AI.method: 采用混合研究方法，结合真实工业控制系统数据集和模拟攻击场景，评估不同深度学习模型的检测准确性、误报率和计算效率。
AI.findings: 自编码器模型在检测细微异常方面表现最佳且误报率最低，RNN模型在捕获网络流量的时间依赖性方面表现出鲁棒性。
AI.theory_contributions: 丰富了深度学习在网络安全领域的应用理论，为不同深度学习架构在异常检测中的性能比较提供了理论依据。
AI.practical_contributions: 为关键基础设施的网络安全防护提供了实用的深度学习模型选择指导，有助于提升实时威胁检测能力。

title: Modular Diffusion: Decomposing Conditional Image Synthesis into Interpretable Components
affiliations: LADOKE AKINTOLA UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY OGBOMOSO, NIGERIA

detail.title: Modular Diffusion: Decomposing Conditional Image Synthesis into Interpretable Components
detail.abstract: This paper presents a comprehensive review and conceptual framework for "Modular Diffusion," a paradigm shift in generative modeling that reframes diffusion models from monolithic, black-box systems into structured, interpretable components. The analysis traces the evolution from foundational Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DDPMs) to modern architectures like Latent Diffusion Models (LDMs), highlighting the central role of a modular design in enabling fine-grained control over the image synthesis process. The report systematically analyzes how architectural and functional modularity, exemplified by frameworks like ControlNet and compositional operators, provides a foundation for decomposing the generative process. A crucial component of this decomposition is the enhanced interpretability, and this work examines how techniques such as latent space exploration, attention-based probing, and component attribution reveal the semantic underpinnings of model behavior. Finally, the report demonstrates the practical utility of this modular approach in high-impact downstream tasks, including semantic segmentation, domain adaptation, and high-fidelity image-to-image translation. This analysis argues that modularity and interpretability are not merely technical improvements but are essential prerequisites for advancing the field of generative AI responsibly and efficiently.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了"模块化扩散"的概念框架，将扩散模型从单一黑盒系统重构为结构化、可解释的组件，分析了从DDPM到LDM的演进，重点探讨了模块化设计如何实现图像合成过程的精细控制、可解释性增强以及在语义分割、领域适应等高影响力任务中的实际应用。
AI.research_question: 如何通过模块化设计重构扩散模型，使其从黑盒系统转变为结构化、可解释的组件，从而实现对图像合成过程的精细控制和语义理解？

AI.theoretical_framework: 模块化扩散理论框架，包括架构模块化（如ControlNet框架）和功能模块化（组合操作符），以及可解释性技术（潜在空间探索、注意力机制探测、组件归因）。
AI.method: 系统性文献综述和概念框架构建，分析从DDPM到LDM的架构演进，研究模块化设计原理和可解释性技术。
AI.findings: 模块化设计能够有效分解生成过程，提供精细控制；可解释性技术能够揭示模型行为的语义基础；模块化方法在语义分割、领域适应、图像到图像转换等任务中具有显著实用价值。

AI.practical_contributions: 为高影响力下游任务（如语义分割、领域适应、高保真图像转换）提供了实用的模块化解决方案，推动了生成式AI在实际应用中的负责任和高效发展。

title: Education, Sorting and Wages: A Structural Matching Approach
affiliations: New York University (NYU) - New York University, Abu Dhabi

detail.title: Education, Sorting and Wages: A Structural Matching Approach
detail.abstract: This paper proposes a novel empirical framework for capturing drivers in the wage structure. It generalizes the one-to-one random utility matching framework to a oneto-many setting, and enables the estimation of workers' non-wage amenities and firms' productivity using observed matching and wage distributions. Crucially, the one-tomany framework allows identification of cross-complementarity terms between workers in both non-wage amenities and productivity, in addition to the standard sorting between workers and firms. This makes it possible to identify how worker segregation impacts wage gaps, along with worker and firm sorting. The paper applies the framework to the Portuguese labor market, and shows that the compression of the wage structure along the education dimension is not only driven by an education expansion, but also by a reduction in complementarities in productivity between educated workers.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一个新颖的实证框架来分析工资结构的驱动因素，将一对一随机效用匹配框架扩展到一对多设置，能够通过观察到的匹配和工资分布来估计工人的非工资福利和企业的生产率。该框架特别能够识别工人之间的交叉互补性，并应用于葡萄牙劳动力市场，发现教育维度工资结构压缩不仅由教育扩张驱动，还由受教育工人之间生产率互补性的减少所致。

AI.method: 提出新颖的实证框架，利用观察到的匹配和工资分布数据，估计工人的非工资福利和企业的生产率，特别关注工人之间的互补性效应

title: From Virtual Views to Physical Visits: Extending the Theory of Planned Behavior in Destination Retailing
affiliations: University of North Texas and University of North Texas

detail.title: From Virtual Views to Physical Visits: Extending the Theory of Planned Behavior in Destination Retailing
detail.abstract: Video-based social media platforms such as TikTok, Instagram Reels, and Facebook Stories have become influential tools in shaping consumer perceptions and behaviors toward destination retail locations. This study examines how persuasive elements in such videos, perceived usefulness, curiosity, and envy, affect consumer attitudes and visit intentions, using an extended Theory of Planned Behavior (TPB) framework. An online survey of 311 Gen Z and Millennial consumers, who are active social media users, was conducted. Data were analyzed using structural equation modeling. Findings reveal that perceived usefulness, curiosity, and envy significantly influence attitudes, which in turn positively predict visit intentions. Subjective norms also positively affect both attitudes and visit intentions, whereas perceived behavioral control does not significantly influence visit intentions. These results highlight the cognitive and emotional mechanisms driving offline retail visitation following online exposure to short-form video content. The study contributes to retail and consumer services literature by extending TPB with contemporary digital marketing variables and by demonstrating the persuasive power of social media videos in the retail context. Practical recommendations are offered for destination retailers to design video content that enhances perceived usefulness, evokes benign envy, sparks curiosity, and leverages social validation to increase foot traffic.

detail.abstract: Identifying high growth startups ex-ante and fostering their success is an important policy challenge. Using Swedish registry data, we show that previous labor market earnings of entrepreneurs is a simple observable that is strongly correlated with entrepreneurship success. Entrepreneurs from the top decile of income from dependent employment are four times more likely to succeed than those from the lowest decile. Their firms are larger and more productive from the outset, and this effect intensifies over time. This correlation is virtually unaffected by variations in the entrepreneurs' personal traits. It does also not vary across the business cycle.

title: From Theory to Code: The OntoMotoOS LE-MVP, A Minimal Executable Framework for Decentralized Ethical Governance
affiliations: Independent Researcher, South Korea

detail.title: From Theory to Code: The OntoMotoOS LE-MVP, A Minimal Executable Framework for Decentralized Ethical Governance
detail.abstract:
Traditional operating systems were not built to meet the ethical alignment, transparency, and decentralized control needs of complex networks of autonomous agents and Artificial Intelligence (AI). This paper introduces OntoMotoOS LE-MVP (Limited Edition – Minimal Viable Prototype), a minimal framework for an OS that embeds ethics and decentralized governance at its core. Its central feature is a mesh-branch architecture: a networked “mesh” of agents for consensus and a “branching” system for safe experimentation.

Unlike conventional OSes focused on hardware management, OntoMotoOS—rooted in the Illumination AI Matrix Framework (IAMF) and OntoFormula—treats each AI and human agent as a first-class entity with identity and ethical commitments. Major decisions occur via peer-to-peer consensus, with all actions logged on the immutable PhoenixRecord ledger for transparency and accountability.

The paper’s contribution is making these advanced concepts accessible through a minimal executable framework, enabling experimentation without large-scale infrastructure. Examples include concise state models, JSON-based policies, and pseudocode. The goal is to bridge AI ethics theory and practical system design, offering a foundation for engineers and researchers worldwide to apply and extend.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了OntoMotoOS LE-MVP，一个将伦理和去中心化治理嵌入核心的最小化操作系统框架，采用网状-分支架构，通过点对点共识机制和不可变账本实现透明度和问责制。

AI.motivation: 传统操作系统无法满足复杂自主智能体网络和人工智能的伦理对齐、透明度和去中心化控制需求，需要构建新的操作系统框架。

AI.method: 采用网状-分支架构设计：网状网络用于共识机制，分支系统用于安全实验；使用点对点共识决策和PhoenixRecord不可变账本记录所有操作。
AI.findings: 开发了OntoMotoOS LE-MVP最小可行原型，通过简洁状态模型、JSON策略和伪代码实现了高级概念的实用化，使实验无需大规模基础设施。

AI.practical_contributions: 提供了可执行的最小框架，使全球工程师和研究人员能够应用和扩展这一系统，促进伦理AI系统的实际开发和实验。

Looking ahead, the research recommends stronger crosssector collaboration, targeted investment in smart infrastructure, and continuous monitoring mechanisms to ensure long-term success and adaptability.

detail.title: Bitcoin in Satoshi's Own Words
detail.abstract: This document is a verbatim, thematically organized compilation of Satoshi Nakamoto’s writings—drawn from his forum posts, emails, and the Bitcoin whitepaper—presented without paraphrasing or outside interpretation. It traces Satoshi’s reasoning, architecture, and vision for Bitcoin as a peer-to-peer electronic cash system that replaces trust with cryptographic proof. Covering technical design, economic principles, security assumptions, and predictions for adoption, it captures both the engineering precision and the foresight with which Satoshi anticipated mining centralization, smart contracts, and alternative digital currencies. The result is an unfiltered account of Bitcoin’s origin, entirely in Satoshi’s own words.

Consequently, businesses now face both greater opportunities for success and heightened risks of failure. Global economic interaction has existed in various forms since the earliest days of organized society. Since the Industrial Revolution, this integration has accelerated, becoming largely irreversible. This is driven by the fundamental truth that business and profit motivations often transcend national borders, cultural differences, and political boundaries. In this context, strategic management has gained prominence as a discipline distinct from traditional operational management. Unlike techniques that solely aim to improve efficiency, strategic management involves comprehensive planning and alignment with a company’s external environment. Firms that systematically implement strategic management practices tend to outperform those that do not. detail.abstract: This paper outlines the history of two intertwined financial transactions from their inception in 1841 to their ultimate completion in 1849. These were financings of the sale and purchase of 12 locomotives, 450 coal cars, running gear for 600 coal cars, and brakes for the Philadelphia & Reading railroad as it commenced operations in 1842. The P&R was drowning in debt, much already in default. Equipment was being seized in foreclosures. System infrastructure was incomplete. The P&R teetered on the brink of bankruptcy. It had no revenue. The only source of funds was debt. It desperately needed more debt to buy iron rails and complete construction. It desperately needed rolling stock to commence operations and generate a bit of revenue, assuage creditors, and induce lenders to continue to fund. The machine shop of The Proprietors of Locks and Canals on Merrimack River had almost no work in 1841 and 1842. Patrick Tracy Jackson, the L&C treasurer, was considering selling the shop or converting it to a twist mill. Elihu Chauncey, president of the P&R, teased Jackson with an opportunity to build rolling stock for the P&R as it commenced operations. As a condition to award of the building contracts, Chauncy sought a loan from L&C. L&C eschewed debt and lending; it sought equity in the P&R as an entrée to the railroad and anthracite coal industries. After long negotiations, L&C agreed to build the rolling stock for the P&R. Jackson devised a unique financing structure, including unique collateral security and remedies elements, that became core elements of what later emerged as the dominant U.S. equipment finance structure. But with the gain came great pain. The two-year transaction took eight years, with constant machinations and maneuvering, including surreptitious stock purchases and sales to diminish the influence of the Bank of the United States, the first audit of managerial custodianship in U.S. history, relocation of a country seat, a preferred stock gambit, and the delicate and dangerous dance of debt in default. This paper is taken from the introduction to the book Michael J.T. McMillen, Patrick Tracy Jackson: Philadelphia & Reading, published in 2025.

detail.abstract: Recent regulatory developments in the United States and European Union have established patient data access as a fundamental right, yet healthcare data remains fragmented across institutional silos. We present PHeaMeR (Patient's Health and Medical Record), a policy framework that represents the logical evolution from current patient access regulations toward true patient data ownership. This analysis examines how the convergence of the 21st Century Cures Act implementation and the European Health Data Space Regulation creates an unprecedented opportunity to transition from institutioncontrolled health records to patient-owned health profiles. Through analysis of current regulatory gaps, documented care coordination failures costing $30+ billion annually, and emerging patient demand for data control, we demonstrate that patient-owned health records represent both economic necessity and policy inevitability. PHeaMeR provides the first comprehensive policy framework for this transition, establishing principles for patient data sovereignty, cross-border portability, and AI-enhanced personalization. This framework addresses fundamental inefficiencies in current healthcare data architecture while building upon existing regulatory foundations rather than requiring radical policy departures.

detail.title: Before the High Court Reputation, Confusion and Discretion in Australian Trade Mark Law: Taylor v Killer Queen LLC
detail.abstract: In Taylor v Killer Queen LLC, the High Court of Australia will have the opportunity to address three complex and unresolved issues under the Trade Marks Act 1995 (Cth). The first issue relates to one of the key grounds for cancellation of a trade mark registration, namely that another mark had acquired a reputation at the registered mark's priority date and that the use of the later mark at that time would have caused confusion. The appeal will require consideration of how to determine when a trade mark has acquired a reputation and when the use of a similar mark, but in a different commercial field, will cause confusion. The second issue relates to a separate cancellation ground that applies where the use of the registered mark has come to cause confusion post-registration, and will require the High Court to clarify the nature of the use that needs to be considered. The third issue goes to the interpretation of a provision that gives the court discretion not to order the cancellation of a registration, even if one of the aforementioned grounds of cancellation has been made out. We explore each of these issues, highlighting the main areas of uncertainty on which it would be useful to receive guidance from the High Court. We pay particular attention to the third issue, arguing that the provision in question should be interpreted so that it does not in fact give a court any discretion to refuse cancellation where the application for cancellation is based on the first cancellation ground at issue in this case.

detail.title: Machine Learning Techniques for Real-Time Cyber Threat Detection in Critical Infrastructure
detail.abstract: Cyber threats targeting critical infrastructure systems pose severe risks to national security, economic stability, and public safety. This study investigates the application of advanced machine learning (ML) techniques for real-time cyber threat detection in critical infrastructure environments, such as energy grids, transportation networks, and water supply systems. The purpose of the study is to evaluate the effectiveness of supervised, unsupervised, and deep learning models in accurately identifying malicious activities while maintaining low false positive rates and ensuring timely response. To achieve this, the research employs a hybrid methodology combining realtime data collection from simulated industrial control systems (ICS) and public intrusion detection datasets. Feature engineering techniques are applied to capture temporal and behavioral patterns of network traffic. Multiple ML models-including Random Forest, Support Vector Machines, Autoencoders, and Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks-are trained and tested on these datasets. Their performance is assessed using precision, recall, F1-score, detection latency, and scalability metrics. Key findings reveal that deep learning models, particularly LSTM-based architectures, outperform traditional ML algorithms in detecting complex and evolving attack patterns with higher accuracy and faster detection times. However, they require more computational resources and careful tuning to minimize false alarms. The study concludes that integrating ML-driven detection mechanisms with existing security infrastructure can significantly enhance the resilience of critical systems against sophisticated cyber threats, provided that considerations for model interpretability and deployment constraints are addressed.

detail.abstract: This study investigates the strategic potential of repurposing idle rural buildings as multifunctional Green Rural Centres (GRCs) that contribute to China's dual carbon goals as a strategic lever for accelerating carbon neutrality through sustainable rural development. Grounded in fieldwork from Fujian Province and guided by national policy frameworks, the research develops a multidimensional conceptual framework encompassing functional transformation, spatial integration, carbon mitigation, and institutional innovation, offering empirical insights into the scalability and replicability of rural adaptive reuse models. Scenario-based analysis further quantifies the projected impact of such transformations on carbon peak timing and decarbonization pathways. An integrated model combining scenario-based carbon modelling, case study comparison, spatial analysis, and policy evaluation. Results show that the adaptive reuse of just 30% of China's ~68,000 idle rural schools could yield over 400,000 metric tons of CO₂ reduction by 2060, with average annual savings of 1.2 tons per building an 80% improvement in energy performance compared to conventional rural buildings. Sensitivity and elasticity analyses further reveal that modest gains in retrofit quality or uptake rates could quadruple total emissions reductions. Beyond carbon benefits, GRCs offer co-benefits in rural education, community cohesion, ecosystem services, and decentralised infrastructure. The study introduces a five-phase strategic framework for scaling rural retrofits and provides policy recommendations for embedding reuse within broader rural regeneration agendas and mainstream adaptive reuse into national rural regeneration and climate action agendas. These findings contribute to reframing rural idle buildings not as symbols of decline, but as critical assets in the transition toward low-carbon, resilient, and inclusive development while also supporting urban-rural co-dependence through decentralised service provision and spatial equity.

title: Law School in the Age of ChatGPT: Adapting to a New Legal Landscape

detail.title: Law School in the Age of ChatGPT: Adapting to a New Legal Landscape
detail.abstract: The debut of ChatGPT in late 2022 sparked widespread debate in both legal academia and legal practice. For law schools, the technology raises urgent questions about academic integrity, pedagogy, assessment, and professional preparedness. This essay examines how law schools are adapting to generative artificial intelligence, ranging from institutional policies and classroom practices to curriculum design and skills training. It highlights the need to balance exposure to the risks and benefits of AI with the development of fundamental legal knowledge, analytical skills, and ethical judgment, which are all necessary to competent and ethical use of AI. Ultimately, the essay asserts that law schools must prepare students to engage critically, competently, and responsibly with AI as it becomes an integral part of modern legal practice.

AI.motivation: ChatGPT在2022年底推出后，在法律学术界和法律实践中引发了广泛讨论，对法学院校提出了关于学术诚信、教学方法、评估和专业准备的紧迫问题。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于法学教育理论和人工智能伦理框架，探讨技术变革对传统法律教育模式的影响。
AI.method: 论文采用文献分析和案例研究方法，考察法学院校对生成式AI的应对策略和实践经验。
AI.findings: 法学院校需要在暴露AI风险与收益之间找到平衡，同时发展基础法律知识、分析技能和伦理判断能力，这些都是胜任和道德使用AI所必需的。
AI.theory_contributions: 为法学教育理论提供了AI时代下的新视角，构建了技术整合与法律教育融合的理论框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 为法学院校制定AI相关政策、改革课程体系、调整教学方法提供了实践指导，帮助培养学生批判性、能力和负责任地使用AI的能力。

title: Natural Gas Transmission Project and Air Pollution in China
affiliations: ShanghaiTech University and ShanghaiTech University - School of Entrepreneurship and Management

detail.title: Natural Gas Transmission Project and Air Pollution in China
detail.abstract: The overall effects of nationwide environmental policies are ambiguous, especially when multiple levels of government and institutions jointly implement them. Using a 17-year panel dataset (1999–2015) on satellite-based air quality (Aerosol Optical Depth) and nationwide construction information on natural gas pipeline networks from 276 cities, we investigate how the natural gas transmission project (NGTP) has affected air pollution in China. We leverage predicted earliest pipeline connection time as a new instrumental variable to address the endogenous issue in cities' pipeline connection time during the network expansion period. We find that cities' real pipeline connections significantly reduced average air pollution by 8.5%. The magnitude is larger than the OLS estimation. Using the predicted IV and nationwide individual dataset from China Health Nutrition Survey (2000-2015), we also find the project improved residents' health in treated counties. The average individuals' treatment costs decreased by around 4,200 yuan per year, and communities' health scores were significantly improved. As a result of home gas upgrade, heterogeneous effects on health between husbands and wives also exist.

AI.tldr: 本研究利用1999-2015年卫星空气质量数据和天然气管道网络建设信息，通过工具变量方法分析中国天然气传输项目对空气污染和居民健康的影响，发现管道连接使空气污染平均降低8.5%，居民年医疗费用减少约4200元。
AI.research_question: 天然气传输项目（NGTP）如何影响中国城市的空气污染水平和居民健康状况？
AI.motivation: 全国性环境政策的整体效果存在模糊性，特别是在多级政府和机构联合实施的情况下，需要实证评估大型基础设施项目的环境与健康效益。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于环境经济学和健康经济学理论，探讨能源基础设施投资对环境污染和公共健康的因果影响机制。
AI.method: 使用1999-2015年276个城市的卫星空气质量数据（气溶胶光学厚度）和天然气管道网络建设信息，采用预测的最早管道连接时间作为工具变量解决内生性问题，并结合中国健康营养调查的个体数据进行健康效应分析。
AI.findings: 城市实际管道连接使平均空气污染降低8.5%（效果大于OLS估计），居民年医疗费用减少约4200元，社区健康评分显著改善，且存在夫妻间的健康效应异质性。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了预测最早管道连接时间作为新的工具变量方法，为评估大型基础设施项目的环境健康效应提供了可靠的因果识别策略。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政府制定能源转型和环境保护政策提供了实证依据，证明了天然气基础设施建设在改善空气质量和公共健康方面的重要价值，有助于指导未来类似项目的投资决策。

title: Q-Learning and Algorithmic Market Making: Loss-free, Collusive, or Competitive Prices?
affiliations: University College London - Centre for Economic Learning and Social Evolution (ELSE), University College London - Department of Economics and London School of Economics & Political Science (LSE) - Department of Economics

detail.title: Q-Learning and Algorithmic Market Making: Loss-free, Collusive, or Competitive Prices?
detail.abstract: We study whether Algorithmic Market Makers using Q-learning produce competitive or supra-competitive prices in a quote-driven asset market. We show, through simulations and analytically, that the result depends on the way the algorithm is set up. A basic Q-learning algorithm leads to loss-free prices and is, therefore, not fit for trade. Carefully choosing the exploration and learning parameters leads to less extreme prices, but still far away from the competitive ones. When we endow the algorithm with a basic understanding of the market and basic information about outstanding quotes, the Q-learning algorithms produce competitive prices.

AI.tldr: 研究表明，Q-learning算法做市商能否产生竞争性价格取决于算法设置方式。基础Q-learning产生无损失价格不适合交易，适当调整参数可改善但仍非竞争性，只有赋予市场理解和报价信息后才能真正产生竞争性价格。
AI.research_question: 使用Q-learning的算法做市商是否能在报价驱动的资产市场中产生竞争性或超竞争性价格？
AI.motivation: 研究算法做市商在金融市场中的定价行为，特别是Q-learning算法在不同设置下对市场价格形成的影响，为算法做市实践提供理论指导。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于强化学习理论，特别是Q-learning算法框架，结合金融市场微观结构理论和做市商定价理论。
AI.method: 采用仿真模拟和理论分析相结合的方法，通过调整Q-learning算法的探索和学习参数，以及赋予不同层次的市场信息来测试定价效果。
AI.findings: 1) 基础Q-learning算法产生无损失价格，不适合实际交易；2) 精心选择参数可改善价格但仍远离竞争性水平；3) 赋予市场理解和报价信息后，Q-learning算法能产生竞争性价格。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了Q-learning算法在金融市场定价中的局限性，提出了算法做市商需要市场信息整合的理论框架，丰富了算法交易的理论基础。
AI.practical_contributions: 为算法做市商的实际应用提供了重要指导：必须整合市场信息和适当调整参数才能产生有效的竞争性价格，避免产生不适合交易的无损失定价。

title: Post-Sale Similarity and a Likelihood of Confusion: Lessons for New Zealand
affiliations: University of Auckland - Faculty of Law

detail.title: Post-Sale Similarity and a Likelihood of Confusion: Lessons for New Zealand
detail.abstract: The United Kingdom Supreme Court’s judgment in Iconix Luxembourg Holdings SARL v Dream Pairs Europe Inc (Iconix) considered the impact of post-sale circumstances when assessing trade mark infringement. This decision is likely to be persuasive when considering trade mark infringement disputes in New Zealand, as well as in other British Commonwealth jurisdictions. In this article, I explain, contextualise and critically evaluate the findings of the UK Supreme Court regarding the relevance of post-sale circumstances when addressing mark similarity and the relevance of post-sale confusion when assessing a likelihood of confusion. However, the main contribution of the article is to interrogate the law regarding infringement under s 89 of New Zealand’s Trade Marks Act 2002 (2002 Act). Viewing Iconix through a comparative lens, I demonstrate that New Zealand courts’ current approach to s 89 is unsettled and conceptually ambiguous. As a result, it is difficult to determine (if Iconix were to be followed) how post-sale circumstances would be sensibly factored into assessing infringement. Using Iconix as a launching pad, I put forward a model for interpreting s 89 of the 2002 Act and, in so doing, suggest a way for New Zealand courts to cogently factor post-sale context into the assessment of infringement.

AI.tldr: 本文分析了英国最高法院Iconix案判决对商标侵权中售后情形评估的影响，重点探讨了该判决对新西兰商标法第89条解释的启示，并提出新的解释模型。

AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一个新的解释模型来理解新西兰商标法第89条，为将售后背景因素纳入侵权评估提供了理论框架。

detail.title: The Impact of AI on Veteran Employment and the Future Workforce Development: Opportunities, Barriers, and Systemic Solutions
detail.abstract: This paper explores the intersection of artificial intelligence (AI), workforce development, and veteran employment. As AI continues to reshape industries, understanding its implications for displaced workers and veterans transitioning to civilian careers is critical, particularly veterans and displaced workers. We review existing literature, analyze policy recommendations, and highlight initiatives aimed at leveraging AI for workforce training and veteran job placement. The paper synthesizes findings from government reports, academic studies, and industry insights to provide a comprehensive overview of current trends and future directions. This paper further examines the evolving landscape of work, the role of upskilling and reskilling in addressing the skills gap, and the unique position of veterans as a strategic workforce asset. It explores how AI is not only redefining job tasks but also serving as a tool to aid veterans in their transition from military to civilian life. Furthermore, the paper highlights key governmental and private-sector initiatives, including policies from the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) and public-private partnerships, designed to leverage AI for workforce development and veteran empowerment. This paper surveys current literature, policy developments, training programs, public-private partnerships, and technology trajectories to illuminate the rapidly evolving workforce ecosystem. Special attention is given to veterans' transition from military to civilian jobs, with AI both as a skills multiplier and a disruptor. This is a review paper and all findings are from cited literature.

title: Nationwide High-Resolution Heat Risk Projections and Intervention Cost Analysis for the Elderly in Japan Under Climate and Demographic Changes
affiliations: National Institute for Environmental Studies, National Institute for Environmental Studies, National Institute for Environmental Studies, National Institute for Environmental Studies, University of Tsukuba, National Institute for Environmental Studies and National Institute for Environmental Studies

detail.title: Nationwide High-Resolution Heat Risk Projections and Intervention Cost Analysis for the Elderly in Japan Under Climate and Demographic Changes
detail.abstract: Global warming and population aging are amplifying heat-related health risks in Japan. The country is experiencing rapid warming and demographic aging, records approximately 1,000 heatstroke deaths annually, over 80% of which involve elderly people. With a large elderly population, targeted interventions that account for climate and demographic changes are essential. This study estimated, at a 1 km resolution, the distribution and total of the at-risk elderly population (AREP), defined as the elderly population residing in grid cells where wet-bulb globe temperatures reach heatstroke risk thresholds, and potential cumulative exposure (PCE, person-hours), the product of AREP and exposure duration, under four shared socioeconomic pathways (SSP1–1.9, SSP1–2.6, SSP2–4.5, SSP5–8.5). We also projected intervention costs for air-conditioner installation and electricity subsidies. For the 2060s to the 2080s, using alternative heatstroke alert criteria (AHAC) thresholds that reflect the regional vulnerability of the elderly, AREP was widely distributed across the mainland and southern areas, totaling 30–32 million. In most municipalities, AREP exceeded 40% of the local population. PCE varied markedly by scenarios, reaching 10.0 billion person-hours under SSP5–8.5, more than double the 4.8 billion under SSP1–1.9. Annual intervention costs were estimated at 164 to 177 million USD using 4% discount rate. These costs were offset only when a low discount rate (0.1%) was applied to future health impacts, underscoring the ethical implications of discounting in intergenerational health risk assessments. Our findings provide spatially detailed insights to support the design of effective, targeted interventions for managing future heat-health risks.

AI.tldr: 本研究估计了日本未来气候变化情景下老年人口的热暴露风险和干预成本，发现高风险老年人口广泛分布，潜在累积暴露量在不同情景下差异显著，干预成本在低贴现率下才能抵消健康效益。

AI.method: 使用1公里分辨率网格数据，定义高风险老年人口(AREP)和潜在累积暴露量(PCE)，在四种SSP情景下进行预测，并估算空调安装和电费补贴的干预成本。

title: Revisiting the Link between Electrification and Fertility: Evidence from the Early 20th Century United States

detail.title: Revisiting the Link between Electrification and Fertility: Evidence from the Early 20th Century United States
detail.abstract: This paper presents empirical and theoretical evidence on the link between the sharp decline in US fertility from 1900 to 1940 and the expansion of electricity. Using data on early electrification efforts, I identify two channels connecting electrification and fertility: time-saving household appliances, which reduced child-rearing demands, and rising female wages, which increased the opportunity cost of childcare. A calibrated quantitative model incorporating both channels shows that electrification accounts for 3.1% of the fertility decline in 1900–1940. This modest effect reflects the offsetting nature of the two channels and prevailing labor norms that limited female labor force attachment.

AI.motivation: 理解20世纪上半叶美国生育率显著下降的经济和社会驱动因素，特别是技术进步（电力普及）在其中所起的作用。

title: Natural Gas Transmission Project and Air Pollution in China

detail.title: Natural Gas Transmission Project and Air Pollution in China
detail.abstract: The overall effects of nationwide environmental policies are ambiguous, especially when multiple levels of government and institutions jointly implement them. Using a 17-year panel dataset (1999–2015) on satellite-based air quality (Aerosol Optical Depth) and nationwide construction information on natural gas pipeline networks from 276 cities, we investigate how the natural gas transmission project (NGTP) has affected air pollution in China. We leverage predicted earliest pipeline connection time as a new instrumental variable to address the endogenous issue in cities' pipeline connection time during the network expansion period. We find that cities' real pipeline connections significantly reduced average air pollution by 8.5%. The magnitude is larger than the OLS estimation. Using the predicted IV and nationwide individual dataset from China Health Nutrition Survey (2000-2015), we also find the project improved residents' health in treated counties. The average individuals' treatment costs decreased by around 4,200 yuan per year, and communities' health scores were significantly improved. As a result of home gas upgrade, heterogeneous effects on health between husbands and wives also exist.

AI.tldr: 本研究使用17年面板数据和工具变量方法，发现中国天然气管道项目使城市空气污染平均降低8.5%，并显著改善居民健康，年医疗费用减少约4200元，但存在夫妻间的异质性健康效应。

AI.practical_contributions: 为政府评估天然气管道项目的环境健康效益提供实证依据，支持清洁能源基础设施投资的决策，为改善空气质量和公共健康政策提供参考。

detail.abstract: We explore the challenges facing the current academic training of economists in small European countries like Sweden. The monolithic focus on publishing in the top-five journals, which prioritizes methodological rigor over problem-driven research, is often a threat to social relevance and policy applicability. This limits pluralism, excludes many talented economists, and fails to prepare graduates for non-academic positions. We propose a two-track model for PhD training and academic evaluation, emphasizing both traditional research and applied economic policy, tailored to the diverse needs of academia, public administration and business sectors. We also argue for broader evaluation criteria, enhanced interdisciplinary collaboration, and institutional reforms, including trial lectures and specialized research institutes. By diversifying incentives, we recommend a shift towards socially relevant and more inclusive education and practice in the discipline of economics.

detail.abstract: This paper examines the time-varying effects of geopolitical risks on both the level and volatility of global inflation. We estimate a time-varying parameter structural VAR with stochastic volatility using monthly data from 83 countries, spanning January 1998 to March 2023. The results show that the inflation response to geopolitical risk shocks is strongly state-dependent: modestly disinflationary during demanddeficient periods such as the Global Financial Crisis, but strongly inflationary in recent years, particularly after the COVID-19 pandemic and around the Russia-Ukraine war. Most strikingly, geopolitical risk shocks consistently increase the volatility of global inflation. These findings underscore the dual challenge geopolitical risk poses for monetary policy: managing both inflation and its instability in an increasingly uncertain world, where such shocks act less as independent drivers than as amplifiers of prevailing macroeconomic conditions.

detail.abstract: We study the role of the English Industrial Revolution in promoting social mobility and ending the society of orders: one based on rigid social categories and regulated by inherited characteristics. We combine two new datasets on individual wealth holdings before and after the Industrial Revolution. Our main finding is that noble and gentry titles as well as surnames explain significantly less of the variation in wealth after the Industrial Revolution. Moreover, these declines are substantially larger in the parts of England most impacted by the Revolution. We also explore the extent to which different characteristics predict being rich. We then study a key facet of this increased social mobility-geographical and occupational mobility. We show that people with surnames that were more mobile tended to be in the north and working in manufacturing. Moreover, areas that experienced greater outward mobility were more urbanized; less agrarian; had institutionalized markets; more gentry; were poorer (as proxied by tax revenues); and were more likely to be the residence of a member of parliament.

detail.title: Dynamics of Natural Increase and Population Change in African Nations
detail.abstract: This article examines the demographic dynamics of natural increase-defined as the difference between crude birth and crude death rates-across African nations. Drawing on data from the United Nations Population Division, Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS), and the World Bank, the study analyzes key indicators such as fertility, mortality, life expectancy, and their regional variations. Results indicate that while declining mortality, especially among children and mothers, has contributed to population growth, persistently high fertility rates in many sub-Saharan countries sustain rapid natural increase. Comparative analysis reveals significant differences between nations in advanced demographic transition, such as Egypt and South Africa, and those in earlier stages, such as Niger and the Democratic Republic of Congo. Socioeconomic factors-including female education, access to healthcare, and urbanization-are found to strongly correlate with fertility decline. The paper concludes that managing Africa's population growth requires targeted, context-specific policies focused on women's empowerment, reproductive health, and strategic investment in human capital to harness the potential demographic dividend.

detail.abstract: The 2020 Oxford Union speech by Mick Mulvaney - defending Donald Trump whom he had called "a terrible human being" in 2016 - revealed a troubling pattern demanding investigation. This study examines whether Mulvaney's sophisticated transformation from critic to enabler represents an individual anomaly or exposes systematic vulnerabilities in democratic systems. Using systematic timeline analysis with structural break detection, we document the transformation patterns of ten prominent Republicans who initially opposed Trump. We find a four-phase progression (Initial Resistance → Gradual Accommodation → Sophisticated Defense → Institutional Enabling) replicated across 90% of cases, with clear temporal break points averaging 18 months. The study identifies six distinct rationalization mechanisms - intellectual, institutional, career, foreign policy, oscillatory, and identity-based - that share common "enabler psychology" functions: epistemic conditional compliance (truth becomes negotiable), constitutional conditional compliance (democratic principles become contingent), and critical loyalism (acknowledging flaws while providing systematic cover). The January 6, 2021 insurrection created temporary resistance in 70% of cases, yet all but one resumed enablement within six months. Strong correlation (r=0.78, p<0.01) exists between transformation speed and career advancement opportunities. These findings reveal that democratic erosion in advanced democracies operates through predictable elite psychological patterns that convert democratic guardians into sophisticated enablers of anti-democratic behavior. The intellectual frameworks developed by educated elites to rationalize their transformations - from "binary choice" arguments to "elite failure" narratives - provide crucial legitimacy for democratic backsliding. Without structural reforms addressing these psychological and institutional vulnerabilities, the patterns documented here may serve as blueprints for democratic capture globally. The research contributes to democratic theory by identifying specific mechanisms of elite transformation and offers practical interventions for democratic defense.

detail.abstract: We analyze the reporting response to an ambitiously targeted support scheme for Norwegian businesses at the very start of the Corona virus crisis in 2020. Our empirical design is based on cross-checking the self-reported data in the applications for support with administratively reported data used for VAT. We find strong evidence that strategic misreporting was present but conclude that its remaining quantitative extent after the enforcement actions already taken by the tax authorities was relatively small. Firms tend to misreport 4 percent more often than expected and the actual support paid out was 5 percent higher than what it should have been. We discuss possible reasons for the relatively limited extent of non-compliance and more general lessons for the design of transfer programs.

detail.title: Literacy Development in Sub-Saharan Africa: Challenges, Progress, and Policy Implications
detail.abstract: Literacy constitutes a foundational pillar of human capital development, influencing individual empowerment, social inclusion, and macroeconomic growth. In Sub-Saharan Africa, however, literacy acquisition remains a critical and persistent challenge despite decades of educational expansion and substantial international investment. While primary school enrollment rates have markedly increased, literacy proficiency-particularly functional reading and writing skills-lags behind, with the region recording some of the lowest adult and youth literacy rates globally. This study investigates the state of literacy development in Sub-Saharan Africa through a mixed-methods design, integrating quantitative analysis of longitudinal data from UNESCO, the World Bank, and national demographic surveys with qualitative synthesis of policy documents, academic literature, and program evaluations. Findings reveal a pronounced disconnect between educational access and learning outcomes, with over 80% of Grade 2 learners in several countries unable to read a simple sentence in any language. Key structural impediments include inadequate teacher training in early-grade reading pedagogy, insufficient instructional resources, overcrowded classrooms, and the persistent mismatch between home languages and the colonial or official languages used in formal education. Linguistic diversity-while culturally enriching-compounds instructional challenges when education systems fail to incorporate mother-tongue-based multilingual education in early years. Gender disparities remain acute, with female literacy rates trailing male counterparts by up to 30 percentage points in some regions, driven by socio-cultural norms, early marriage, and household labor expectations. Policy analysis underscores that interventions such as mother-tongue instruction, community-based reading initiatives, conditional cash transfers, and school feeding programs can yield measurable literacy gains when embedded within coherent, well-resourced national strategies. However, many promising initiatives remain pilot-scale, donor-dependent, and poorly integrated into systemic educational frameworks, limiting sustainability and scalability. The study argues that addressing literacy deficits in Sub-Saharan Africa demands an integrated policy approach that aligns curriculum design, teacher professional development, language policy, and community engagement. It advocates for early-grade instruction in local languages, gender-responsive educational strategies, strengthened teacher preparation, and robust monitoring systems to ensure accountability. Ultimately, improving literacy in the region is not solely an educational objective but a developmental imperative with far-reaching implications for public health, democratic participation, and economic 2 resilience. The research calls for sustained political commitment, cross-sectoral collaboration, and evidence-driven policy design to transform literacy from a persistent deficit into a catalyst for equitable and sustainable development.

detail.title: The Real Effects of Going Cashless: Evidence from China's Provinces
detail.abstract: We examine the effects of cashless payment growth on regional economic performance using quarterly panel data for 31 Chinese provinces from 2017 to 2023. Following a change-on-change regression design and addressing endogeneity via social-trust-based instruments, we find that greater adoption of cashless payments significantly accelerates real GDP growth. Disaggregated analysis reveals that the effect is concentrated in the secondary and tertiary sectors and is primarily driven by card-based transactions, with note-based payments contributing mainly to the primary sector. Decomposition by transaction metrics shows that both higher transaction frequency and larger average transaction values—especially for card payments—drive the growth effect. The impact is substantially stronger in provinces with lower financial development and in the post-COVID-19 period, consistent with theories of financial inclusion and the role of contactless payments in sustaining activity during public health crises. Mechanism tests indicate that the expansion of cashless payments is associated with reduced income inequality, which in turn supports more inclusive growth. Further analysis shows positive spillovers to fiscal revenues, enterprise creation, and fixed asset investment. Overall, our findings highlight cashless payment infrastructure as a catalyst for broad-based economic development in digitally transitioning economies.

detail.abstract: This book chapter examines Advanced Codec Technology, LLC v. Guangdong Oppo Mobile Telecommunications Co., Ltd., the Supreme People's Court of China's first substantive determination of a FRAND license fee. This judgment is significant for its explicit recognition of the comparative license approach (CLA) as a methodology for assessing FRAND royalties, coupled with concrete guidelines for selecting truly comparable licenses. Equally important, the Court characterized FRAND licensing disputes as di yue guo shi (pre-contractual obligations, or culpa in contrahendo) under Article 500 of the Civil Code, establishing a structured framework for assessing both SEP holders' and implementers' faults during negotiations. By integrating fault assessment into damages apportionment, the judgment underscores that both parties must engage in good-faith negotiation efforts, potentially shifting Chinese FRAND litigation toward a more procedure-oriented model. This chapter further situates ACT v. Oppo within the broader trajectory of Chinese SEP jurisprudence, compares it with other landmark cases, and identifies unresolved questions for future clarification by the SPC-ranging from the scope of FRAND-specific good faith, to the role of fault in damages calculation, to thresholds for "adequate negotiations." Properly resolving these open issues will enhance the doctrinal coherence of Chinese FRAND law and its alignment with global SEP enforcement practices.

detail.title: Fueling Fluctuations: The Macroeconomic Impact of Energy Price Shocks in Small Open Economies
detail.abstract: Energy price shocks play a disproportionate role in driving aggregate fluctuations because energy sectors function as hubs in production networks—supplying key inputs to many other central sectors. This hub status allows them to propagate shocks far beyond what their GDP share would suggest. This study quantifies the impact of energy import price shocks on aggregate output in 21 small open European economies, using international sector-level input–output data. I extend the production network framework of Acemoglu et al. (2012) to a small open economy setting and show that the sensitivity of output to such shocks depends on four structural drivers: (i) the network centrality of primary energy products, (ii) the substitutability between domestic and imported energy, (iii) the pre-shock import–domestic price differential, and (iv) the degree of home bias in energy sourcing. Estimated GDP elasticities with respect to energy import prices range from –0.037 to –0.006 across countries, with differences in network centrality accounting for most of the cross-country variation.

detail.title: Modulating Externality: The Joint Impact of Public and Private Ev Chargers on Property Premiums
detail.abstract: Our study reveals the heterogeneity of externalities received from public electric vehicle (EV) chargers based on whether residential apartment complexes have installed private slow EV chargers. Specifically, apartment complexes with installed slow chargers experience complementary effects from nearby fast chargers and partial substitutive effects from public slow chargers, as evidenced by property prices. This implies that by expanding public fast EV chargers, real estate owners can leverage the complementary effects with private chargers to generate additional wealth, thereby encouraging the installation of private EV chargers. Furthermore, in an urban context, government expenditures for expanding EV charging infrastructure provide economic benefits sufficient to offset government spending and yield significant gains for both the private and public sectors.

detail.abstract: With higher education costs consistently outpacing inflation and public funding declining, college affordability has become a critical barrier to economic mobility for middle-and low-income families. While College Savings Accounts (CSAs), or 529 plans, offer tax-advantaged vehicles for college savings, their adoption patterns and educational impacts remain poorly understood. Using comprehensive administrative data from over 900,000 Illinois 529 accounts (2000-2023) linked to educational outcomes, plus complementary surveys of account owners and parents, we provide the first large-scale analysis of CSA participation and effectiveness. We find that while CSA adoption has expanded to every ZIP code in Illinois, participation remains concentrated among higherincome, more educated families. Financial literacy emerges as a key barrier: 61% of parents who could save enough to cover half of future college costs still perceive their potential savings as meaningless. Among participants, higher savings are strongly correlated with better educational outcomes, including four-year college enrollment, attendance at selective institutions, and the pursuit of postgraduate degrees. These findings suggest that targeted interventions addressing financial literacy gaps and misperceptions about modest savings could significantly expand CSA effectiveness as a tool for educational equity. Beyond state-level 529 program optimization, our findings suggest several promising avenues for federal policy coordination and institutional innovation.

AI.tldr: 本文通过分析伊利诺伊州90万个529账户数据发现，虽然大学储蓄账户(CSA)已覆盖所有地区，但参与仍集中在高收入高教育家庭。财务素养是主要障碍，61%有能力储蓄的家长仍认为小额储蓄无意义。研究显示更高储蓄与更好的教育成果显著相关，建议通过针对性干预提升财务素养来扩大教育公平。

AI.method: 使用伊利诺伊州90万个529账户(2000-2023年)的行政数据，链接教育成果数据，辅以账户所有人和家长的补充调查

detail.title: The Time-Varying Zone-Like and Asymmetric Preference of Central Banks: Evidence from China
detail.abstract: This paper develops a framework to investigate the time-varying asymmetric and zone-like preferences of a central bank. We derive the optimal forward-looking monetary policy rule and explore four distinct types of loss related to inflation, output, and leverage, resulting in 64 distinct models. We estimate these models and utilize the Akaike information criterion (AIC) to select the most suitable one. Using data from 1996 to 2022, we find that the People's Bank of China (PBoC): (1) reacts to inflation gaps with slight asymmetry, featuring a no-intervention zone between-1% and 1%; (2) intervenes asymmetrically in output gaps, displaying stronger inclination toward averting overheating than downturns; (3) applies symmetric regulation to leverage gaps. These findings underscore the PBoC's adaptability and responsiveness to economic fluctuations and its preference for risk management.

title: Part-Time Penalties and Heterogeneous Retirement Decisions
affiliations: University of Tokyo

detail.title: Part-Time Penalties and Heterogeneous Retirement Decisions
detail.abstract: Older male workers exhibit diverse retirement behaviors across occupations and respond differently to policy changes, influenced significantly by the part-time penalty—wage reduction faced by part-time workers compared to their full-time counterparts. Many older individuals reduce their working hours, and in occupations with high part-time penalties, they tend to retire earlier, as observed in data from Japan and the United States. This study develops a general equilibrium model that incorporates occupational choices, endogenous labor supply, highlighting that the impact on the retirement decision is amplified by the presence of assets and pensions. Using the Japanese Panel Study of Employment Dynamics, I find that cutting employees’ pension benefits reduce aggregate labor supply in occupations with high part-time penalties, reducing overall welfare across the economy. Furthermore, a commonly used policy measure—extending the pension eligibility age—is also found to decrease both output and welfare. In contrast, this paper suggests that increasing income tax credits and exempting pension benefits from income taxation can boost labor supply across all occupations. These policies enhance welfare by raising disposable income relative to the reservation wage.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了老年男性工人的退休行为差异，发现兼职惩罚（part-time penalty）是影响退休决策的关键因素。通过建立一般均衡模型和日本就业动态面板数据分析，发现削减养老金福利会降低高兼职惩罚职业的劳动力供给，而延长养老金领取年龄会减少产出和福利。相反，增加所得税抵免和免除养老金所得税可以提高所有职业的劳动力供给和福利水平。
AI.research_question: 兼职惩罚如何影响老年男性工人的退休决策？不同的养老金政策对劳动力供给和整体福利有什么影响？

AI.theoretical_framework: 一般均衡理论，包含职业选择、内生劳动力供给、资产积累和养老金制度的理论框架，强调兼职惩罚对退休决策的放大效应。

AI.findings: 1）在高兼职惩罚职业中，老年工人倾向于提前退休；2）削减养老金福利会减少高兼职惩罚职业的劳动力供给，降低整体福利；3）延长养老金领取年龄会减少产出和福利；4）增加所得税抵免和免除养老金所得税可以提高所有职业的劳动力供给和福利。

detail.abstract: Most tax systems around the world are highly complex. While several economists have studied the potential costs associated with tax complexity, few have explored if complexity can also have beneficial effects. In a novel model where taxpayers can acquire costly knowledge to reduce their tax burden, we show that when elasticities of taxable income are heterogeneous, a complex tax system can act as a sorting device similar to second-degree price discrimination, where more elastic taxpayers will invest in more tax knowledge. We prove that if elasticities are increasing with income, introducing tax complexity can allow the government to raise higher tax revenues at no efficiency cost. However, we show that complexity primarily benefits the highest earners and thus exacerbates inequality. In the empirical section of our work, we study a complex tax system in Norway. Using rich register data on business owners, we demonstrate that many taxpayers make accounting decisions that cause them to pay higher taxes than would have been possible, and we quantify the exact size of this tax overpayment at the individual level. We show that overpayment tends to be larger for women, the less wealthy, and immigrants. We validate our model predictions by showing that failure to optimize is associated with a lower estimated tax elasticity.

AI.tldr: 这篇论文研究税政复杂性的双重效应，通过理论模型和实证分析发现税政复杂性可以提高收入但加剧不平等，过多缴纳税温和低弹性税收人群受害最大。
AI.research_question: 税政复杂性是否以及如何产生积极效应？复杂性如何影响税收收入和分配正义？
AI.motivation: 众多税收系统极其复杂，但现有研究主要关注复杂性的成本，忽视了其潜在的好处。本文探索复杂性是否可以作为一种排序机制来提高税收效率。
AI.theoretical_framework: 二级价格医判模型，税费者可以投资成本获得知识来降低税负，复杂税政系统作为排序机制区分不同弹性税收者。
AI.method: 理论建模分析税政复杂性的税收和效率影响，使用挪威实际注册数据实证分析业主的账务决策和税负情况。
AI.findings: 当弹性随收入增加时，复杂性可以在无效率成本下提高税收收入，但主要惠及最高收入者并加剧不平等。实证显示女性、资产较少者和移民更容易多缴纳税欩，且这与低弹性相关。

detail.abstract: This paper investigates the long-run impact of demographic trends on government debt dynamics in the United States and five major European economies. Using a dynamic model that integrates demographic projections into the intertemporal government budget constraint, we show that ageing populations exert upward pressure on debt-to-GDP ratios by dampening output growth, weakening primary fiscal balances, and causing a negative differential between the rate of output growth and the average cost of financing the debt. While Germany and the Netherlands benefit from relatively favorable demographic fundamentals and disciplined fiscal policy, countries like Italy, Spain, France, and the US face increasing debt sustainability risks. Counterfactual simulations highlight that sustained migration inflows can significantly mitigate these risks by improving the age structure of the population, raising growth, and lowering fiscal deficits. These findings underscore the importance of demographic-aware fiscal frameworks and the role of migration policy as a tool for macroeconomic stabilization.

AI.tldr: 人口老龄化通过抑制经济增长、削弱财政平衡和扩大增长利率差，对政府债务可持续性构成长期压力。德国和荷兰因有利人口结构和财政纪律表现较好，而意大利、西班牙、法国和美国面临较大债务风险。移民流入可显著改善人口年龄结构，缓解债务压力。
AI.research_question: 人口趋势如何长期影响美国及五个主要欧洲经济体的政府债务动态？
AI.motivation: 研究人口老龄化对政府债务可持续性的长期影响，为制定人口敏感型财政框架提供依据。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于跨期政府预算约束的动态模型，整合人口预测与经济变量。
AI.method: 构建动态模型，将人口预测纳入政府预算约束，进行反事实模拟分析。
AI.findings: 老龄化通过抑制产出增长、削弱基本财政平衡、造成增长与融资成本负向差异，推高债务GDP占比。移民流入可显著改善人口结构并降低财政赤字。
AI.theory_contributions: 建立了人口因素与政府债务动态的理论联系框架，拓展了跨期预算约束理论的应用范围。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供了人口敏感型财政框架的设计依据，强调了移民政策作为宏观经济稳定工具的重要性。

detail.title: The Role of ECA in the Issue of Stimulating Ukrainian High-Tech Exports during War
detail.abstract: The article is devoted to the study of the problem of stimulating the production and export of high-tech products, in particular, during martial law, and the role of the Export Credit Agency (hereinafter-ECA) in this matter. As of today, the role of the state in providing favorable conditions for the promotion of high-tech products in foreign markets is growing significantly. At the same time, the role of the state is not so much in direct assistance to business entities (which is quite difficult given the financial situation of the state during the war), but in the use of other effective tools and institutions designed to stimulate production and export of high-tech products. At present, the Export Credit Agency of Ukraine is considered to be such an effective institution. detail.title: Composition Beats Collapse: Insights from the Bisin-Verdier Model on Endogenous Fertility Reversal
detail.abstract: Fertility rates have fallen below replacement in most countries, fueling predictions of demographic collapse and even human extinction. These forecasts overlook a crucial fact: societies are not homogeneous. Using the Bisin-Verdier model of cultural transmission with endogenous direct socialization, calibrated to U.S. and global religion data, we identify an evolutionary counterforce. Subpopulations with persistently high fertility survive, expand their share, and push population-weighted fertility upward over time. Even if every country's aggregate total fertility rate (TFR) remains below replacement, the persistence of above-replacement groups makes extinction unlikely. Our simulations point to a future of growth with pronounced compositional change-driven above all by high-fertility religious communities-rather than collapse. In particular, our results imply that Muslims will constitute the largest share of the future world population.

title: Facial Recognition Technology and the First Amendment
affiliations: Maurer School of Law Indiana University

detail.title: Facial Recognition Technology and the First Amendment
detail.abstract:
The growing ubiquity of facial recognition technology (FRT) is a problem. While much has been written on harmful government use of FRT, little has been written regarding harmful private actor use. This Article helps fill a gap in the literature by providing a detailed analysis of the First Amendment interests at stake when private actors use FRT. Specifically, this Article analyzes whether laws that limit the use of publicly available photographs to create faceprints for inclusion in FRT databases violate the First Amendment rights of private actors.

In May 2025, a multidistrict litigation against Clearview AI, an FRT company, offered an opportunity to answer that question, but it settled. The court stated that the “settlement agreement leaves unresolved the question that motivated this multidistrict litigation: whether the collection of publicly available biometric information for use by private or government entities . . . is reconcilable with constitutional privacy rights.” This Article helps answer that unresolved question. But privacy is too narrow a framework. Constitutional rights of free speech, association and assembly are also affected.

This Article makes two claims, one descriptive and one normative. The descriptive claim is two-fold: (1) existing First Amendment law does not resolve the novel question of whether laws that limit how private actors use publicly available images violate their First Amendment rights, and (2) free speech advocates are divided on the proper response. The normative claim answers the unresolved question by concluding that some regulation of private actor use of publicly available images to create faceprints and FRT databases should be found constitutionally permissible.

Not only does this Article analyze the First Amendment arguments of FRT companies like Clearview AI, but it also introduces the other half of the story: the First Amendment interests of the faceprinted. After identifying problematic uses of FRT and showing the inadequacy of existing law, this Article makes the normative argument by engaging with three methods of constitutional interpretation, identifying First Amendment values that support regulating the use of FRT, and drawing lessons from Fourth Amendment doctrine and theory.

detail.title: Spillovers and Common Investor Attention in Institutional Fund Networks
detail.abstract: This paper constructs dynamic networks of institutional funds based on investors' revealed preferences, captured through co-viewership on a leading asset management platform. Shocks to peer funds-identified solely through shared investor attention-predict subsequent returns and flows of focal funds, above and beyond the effects of overlapping stock holdings, style similarity, and textual similarity in fund prospectuses. Consistent with limited investor attention, these spillover effects are sluggish and amplified for connections that investors tend to overlook. Fund managers actively respond to negative spillovers by rebalancing portfolios away from attention-linked peers. In contrast, idiosyncratic peer shocks-such as key manager departures-generate positive inflows to attention-linked funds. The findings reveal an investor attention-based channel of shock propagation across institutional funds, with important implications for diversification across multiple fund managers and the stability of the sector.

title: Paternity Leave and Fertility Decisions
affiliations: Nihon University - College of Economics

detail.title: Paternity Leave and Fertility Decisions

declarations.funderStatement: JSPS KAKENHI Grant Numbers 21K13299

detail.abstract: This paper develops a unified theoretical framework to analyze how paternity-leave policies mandating a minimum level of paternal childcare shape household fertility decisions. In our static model, the sign of the fertility effect depends solely on the intra-household wage gap: when fathers earn more than mothers, stricter leave reduces fertility by diverting high-wage labor from the market; when mothers earn more, the reverse holds. When paternal and maternal wages are equal, the model predicts a neutrality: reallocating childcare between parents leaves total household labor income unchanged, so paternity leave alters only the intrahousehold division of time and not the opportunity cost of children. This implies that eliminating the gender wage gap would remove any direct fertility impact of paternity leave-meaning that such policies are more effective when a wage gap exists. A two-period extension shows that insufficient subsidies amplify the negative effect in high-paternal-wage households, while the dynamic model reveals that stricter leave can delay births by lowering the marginal utility of current childbearing in anticipation of future time constraints. Comparative statics from the static, two-period, and dynamic models further reveal a fiscal trade-off: when paternity-leave mandates reduce fertility in high-paternal-wage households, larger subsidies are required to maintain a given fertility target, but childcare subsidies and flexible work can soften this trade-off. An extended static model incorporating childcare subsidies and flexible work arrangements demonstrates that combining paternity leave with both instruments mitigates negative effects in high-paternal-wage households and supports stable fertility while advancing equity objectives. In economies with persistent wage gaps, such a policy portfolio is particularly effective; under full wage equality, paternity leave is demographically neutral unless paired with flexible work, in which case it can increase fertility even without a wage gap.

AI.tldr: 本文构建了一个统一理论框架，分析陪产假政策如何影响家庭生育决策。研究发现陪产假对生育率的影响取决于家庭内部工资差距：当父亲工资更高时，严格陪产假会降低生育率；当母亲工资更高时则相反；工资相等时政策中性。消除性别工资差距会使陪产假失去直接影响生育的效果。

AI.theoretical_framework: 基于家庭决策理论，构建静态模型、两期模型和动态模型，分析陪产假对家庭劳动力配置和生育决策的影响。
AI.method: 理论建模方法，包括静态模型、两期扩展模型和动态模型，进行比较静态分析。
AI.findings: 1）陪产假对生育的影响取决于家庭内部工资差距方向；2）工资相等时政策中性；3）补贴不足会放大高父亲工资家庭的负面效应；4）严格陪产假可能通过预期未来时间约束延迟生育；5）政策组合（陪产假+补贴+灵活工作）能缓解负面效应。
AI.theory_contributions: 建立了统一的陪产假政策理论分析框架，揭示了工资差距在政策效果中的关键作用，提出了政策中性条件。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定提供重要启示：在存在工资差距的经济体中，陪产假需要与 childcare补贴和灵活工作安排相结合才能有效促进生育和性别平等；在工资平等情况下，陪产假需要配合灵活工作才能提高生育率。

title: Forecasting Regional Employment in the Presence of Structural Breaks: Analyzing the Brazilian Formal Labor Market using the Global VAR & IIS Approach
affiliations: Getulio Vargas Foundation (FGV) - Sao Paulo School of Economics, Sao Paulo School of Business Administration - FGV and Getulio Vargas Foundation (FGV) - Sao Paulo School of Economics

detail.title: Forecasting Regional Employment in the Presence of Structural Breaks: Analyzing the Brazilian Formal Labor Market using the Global VAR & IIS Approach
detail.abstract: We address the problem of forecasting variables across regions, taking into account the interdependence linkages between the regions and accounting for structural breaks. The model, identified as GVAR-IIS, uses a global vector autoregressive methodology that deals with the curse of dimensionality augmented with Impulse-Indicator Saturation dummies to account for structural breaks. The model is tested in empirical research focusing on the Brazilian labour market. In the empirical analysis, the GVAR-IIS model is compared against several other forecasting models such as Principal Component Analysis (PCA), Vector Error Correction Model (VECM), as well as the classical GVAR. Forecasts are compared using the Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE) and Mean Absolute Error (MAE) metrics, and a Model Confidence Set (MCS) is computed. The study finds that the GVAR-IIS model is present on the final MCS, and that the IIS procedure can capture the shocks. In conclusion, the study suggests that the GVAR-IIS methodology can provide parsimonious forecasting models taking into account the dynamics of the region's employment and deal, not only with the curse of dimensionality in a manageable form but also deals with structural breaks.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出GVAR-IIS模型，结合全局向量自回归和脉冲指示饱和方法，用于处理区域间相互依赖性和结构断点的变量预测问题，在巴西劳动力市场实证中表现出优于其他模型的预测性能。

AI.method: 采用GVAR-IIS模型，使用Impulse-Indicator Saturation虚拟变量处理结构断点，通过RMSE、MAE和模型置信集(MCS)等指标与其他模型(PCA、VECM、经典GVAR)进行对比评估。

title: Filing While Female: What EEOC Filings Tell us about Workplace Discrimination Severity
affiliations: University of Manitoba - Asper School of Business, The University of Texas at El Paso and Université Laval - Département de Finance et Assurance

detail.title: Filing While Female: What EEOC Filings Tell us about Workplace Discrimination Severity

declarations.declarationOfInterest: We have no conflicts of interest
declarations.funderStatement: Social Science and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC) # 430-2020-00519

detail.abstract: We develop a novel metric of workplace discrimination severity: the gender payout gap in the United States Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) discrimination filings. On average, women receive payouts from discrimination litigation that are about 16% higher than payouts received by men even when controlling for geography, industry, employer, filer, and discrimination characteristics. Women’s cases remain open significantly longer than men’s with similar demographic, case and employer characteristics; we argue that this is due to women’s cases complexity and severity. In addition, we provide extensive statistics about workplace discrimination in U.S. organizations, underscoring the need to account for intersectionality and case complexity when measuring discrimination severity. We also show how our discrimination severity metric can be extended to a race-based or age-based payout gap. Lastly, we document that discrimination severity concentrates in firms with weaker corporate culture, firms with more male independent directors, firms with more men on the board’s subcommittees, less profitable firms and firms with higher financial distress.

affiliations: University of Chicago - Stone Center for Research on Wealth Inequality and Mobility, University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) - Global Economics and Management (GEM) Area, University of Chicago - Stone Center for Research on Wealth Inequality and Mobility and Hong Kong University of Science & Technology (HKUST)

detail.title: A Tale of Two Transitions: Mobility Dynamics in China and Russia after Central Planning

publicationDetails.detailsText: The University of Chicago Stone Center Working Paper Series Paper No. 25-16
publicationDetails.journalName: The University of Chicago Stone Center Working Paper Series

detail.abstract: This paper examines intergenerational mobility in China and Russia during their transitions from central planning to market systems. We consider mobility as movement captured by changes in status between parents and children. We provide estimates of overall mobility, which involves mobility during transition to a system's steady state, as well as steady state mobility, which captures long-run mobility independent of transitional dynamics or shifts in the marginal distribution of outcomes across generations. We further decompose overall mobility into structural and exchange components. We find that China exhibits more overall educational mobility than Russia mostly due to greater structural mobility, while Russia exhibits greater steady state educational mobility. In contrast, both the overall and steady state occupational mobility is similar in China and Russia. Comparing these results to the US, we find that steady state mobility in education is substantially higher in the US and Russia compared to China, but occupational steady state mobility is comparable in all three countries.

title: An Adaptive Residual-Based Test for Factor Structure
affiliations: Shanghai Institute for Mathematics and Interdisciplinary Sciences and Shanghai University of Finance and Economics

detail.title: An Adaptive Residual-Based Test for Factor Structure
detail.abstract: This paper addresses the critical issue of testing static approximate factor models against unspecified alternatives by proposing an adaptive residual-based test. Our methodology is versatile, encompassing alternatives such as factor models with nonlinear factor structures, conditional factor models, and factor models with structural breaks. We first establish the asymptotic properties of a so-called fixed bandwidth-based test, showing its asymptotic normality and power against local alternatives. To enhance the size and power properties while addressing the practical limitations of the fixed bandwidth approach, we propose an adaptive test and establish its asymptotic size correctness and consistency. Simulation studies demonstrate its superior size and power. We further illustrate the practical relevance of our test by applying it to three empirical studies concerning real and financial variables in the global economy.

title: Labour Market Dynamics and Worker Flows in India: Impact of Covid-19
affiliations: Shiv Nadar University and Shiv Nadar University

detail.title: Labour Market Dynamics and Worker Flows in India: Impact of Covid-19
detail.abstract: Tracking and analyzing the labour market dynamics at regular, frequent intervals is critical. However, this was not possible for India, a large emerging economy with a significant population undergoing demographic transition, due to a paucity of data. We use the new dataset Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE)-Consumer Pyramids Household Survey (CPHS) and use a panel to create Labour Flow Charts and Transition Matrices for India from January 2019 to December 2021. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first time these were created for India. We then use that to look at the impact of Covid-19 on the Indian labour market. We not only look at transitions between employment, unemployment and out of labour force, but also across types of employment-full-time and part-time. The rich data also allows us to consider heterogeneity in the labour market and look at the differential impact of the pandemic across different education groups and gender. From the labour flow charts and transition probabilities, we find that while all groups have been impacted, the magnitude of the impact is different across groups. The recovery is also uneven, and the extent depends on education levels. Further, we do an event study analysis to examine the likelihood of getting a full-time job across different educational and gender groups. Men, on average, enjoy a higher likelihood of getting a full-time job than women. The likelihood coefficients also go up with increasing educational qualifications. Looking at skill heterogeneity, while the likelihood of getting a full-time job either goes down for most groups during the pandemic or the change is minuscule, strikingly it goes up for those with no education, for both men and women. The likelihood coefficients remain elevated for men even after the restrictions are removed, and that for women reverts to the level seen before the pandemic. Finally, this paper provides a way to continuously monitor the dynamics of the labour market as data is released in the regular intervals in the future, which would be of great value for researchers and policymakers alike.

detail.title: Institutional Fund Investor Attention
detail.abstract: With more than $40 trillion dollars under management, institutional fund investors play an important role in the financial market. Using novel data on fund viewership, we are the first to examine how these investors allocate attention to specific institutional funds. Exploiting quasi-random variation in screen display features on a prominent institutional asset management platform as instruments, we provide causal evidence that their attention drives flows to institutional funds and exerts positive price pressure on their underlying stocks. Overall, our evidence suggests that even sophisticated institutional fund investors face attention constraints, which have important asset pricing implications.

title: Optimal Cruise Speeds and Environmental Impacts on Energy use of Unmanned Aerial Vehicles for Last-Mile Delivery
